sense.name: insert a primer into
sense.examples: The lieutenant primed the cannon. Soldiers carefully prime mines to trap enemies. The explosives expert quickly primed the bomb.

sense.name: cover with a primer base
sense.examples: The painter primed the walls for its new color. Auto detailers prime cars so they'll take paint better. I forgot to prime my room, so the old color showed through.

sense.name: fill with priming liquid
sense.examples: John primed his new camaro. The mechanic primed the carburator by flushing the lines of air. Sean's unwillingness to prime the engine lead to its explosion.

sense.name: make ready (mentally)
sense.examples: He primed himself for action. The State Senator primed her for a national role.
